intro: Trichosanthes leuserensis, commonly known as the Leuser gourd, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant produces large, elongated fruits that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture. The flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, a characteristic known as monoecious.
